page.title: 11The Holy Trinity Church
page.content: We have two churches in our village, the United Reform Church and the one opposite our school, the Holy Trinity. The latter is a very well noticed landmark as you can see it from each of the six roads that converge on the Heath. There is a plaque on the church which says,{"To the glory of {God, this dedication stone of the {church of Holy Trinity was laid on the {eighth day of July MDCCCLVI by W. {Whewell D.D. Master of Trinity College {Cambridge." }The oldest grave I could find was erected in 1866. All the children from the primary school, which is opposite, attend a termly service in which they read the prayers and also poems and stories they have written. The Village Institute is in the church grounds and it is here that Sunday school classes are held as well as clubs such as Youth Club.
